eshmun.gui.kripke

Class GraphPanel

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • javax.swing.JComponent
          • javax.swing.JPanel
            • eshmun.gui.kripke.GraphPanel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible

    public class GraphPanel
extends javax.swing.JPanel
    This class represents a GraphPanel, responsible for drawing and handling one single kripke strucutre.
    Since:
    1.0
    Author:
    Kinan Dak Al Bab
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

      Zoom in, no specific focus point.
      void zoomIn(java.awt.Point newLocation)
      Zoom in, with the focus point being newLocation (the container would be moved to have this point almost centered), if null no focus point is considered.
      void zoomOut()
      Zoom out, no specific focus point.
      void zoomOut(java.awt.Point newLocation)
      Zoom out, with the focus point being newLocation (the container would be moved to have this point almost centered), if null no focus point is considered.

      • addState

        public void addState(State s)
        Adds a State to the GraphPanel.

        Requires: s has a unique name.

        Undo manger can undo this action.

        Parameters:
        s - state to be added.

      • addState

        public void addState(State s,
                     boolean internal)
        Adds a State to the GraphPanel, if internal is true, it doesn't register it in the undo manager.

        Requires: s has a unique name.

        Parameters:
        s - state to be added.
        internal - flags if the undo manager should be notified.

      • addTransition

        public void addTransition(Transition e)
        Adds a transition to the graph. If the transition is duplicated nothing happen.

        Undo manger can undo this action.

        Parameters:
        e - transition to add.

      • addTransition

                          boolean internal)

        Parameters:

        internal - flags if the undo manager should be notified.

      • isDoubled

        public boolean isDoubled(State from,
                         State to)
        Checks if the transition going from state from to state to is doubled (an opposite transition exist).
        Parameters:
        from - start state.
        to - end state.
        Returns:
        true if the specified transition is doubled, false otherwise.

        Loads the structure, Shows a load dialog then reads a save object from the specified file.

      • load

        public void load(Saveable saveable)
        Loads a structure from the given save object into the GraphPanel.
        Parameters:
        saveable - the saveObject containing the states and transitions.

      • load

        public void load(Saveable saveable,
                 boolean internal)
        Loads a structure from the given save object into the GraphPanel.
        Parameters:
        saveable - the saveObject containing the states and transitions.
        internal - if true, then loading is internal, no repaint, no undo manager.

      • constructDefinition

        public java.lang.String constructDefinition(java.lang.String specifications)
        Construct a string representation / definition of the structure inside.
        Parameters:
        specifications - the specifications of the structure.
        Returns:
        a string representation of the structure.

                           java.lang.String statesDef,
                           java.lang.String transitionsDef)
        Loads a Structure from a string representation of the structure.
        Parameters:

        statesDef - the states definition.
        transitionsDef - the transitions definition.

        Returns:
        true if the name is new, false if it exists.

        Returns:

        Parameters:

        Returns:

        Parameters:
        deletions - a collection of the names of states and transitions to be dashed.
        Returns:

      • dash

        public java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> dash(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> deletions,
                                                   boolean internal)
        Dash the states and transitions given (by var name).
        Parameters:
        deletions - a collection of the names of states and transitions to be dashed.
        internal - if true then dashing is internal, no undo, no repaint.
        Returns:
        an exact list of the names of the states and transitions that were dashed.

      • stripe

        public void stripe(java.util.Collection<java.lang.String> striped)
        Stripe the background of states given (by var name), transitions are not supported.
        Parameters:
        striped - a collection of the names of states to be stripped.

      • restore

        public void restore()
        Restores the transitions that were already dashed.

      • deleteDashed
